children.name: foot
children.definition: the part of your body that you stand on and walk on :
examples: My foot hurts.

children.name: left foot
examples: My left foot ached a bit.

children.name: right foot
examples: He has broken a bone in his right foot.

children.name: front foot
children.definition: of an animal
examples: The tiger has five claws in each of its front feet.

children.name: back/hind foot
children.definition: of an animal
examples: The horse lifted its back foot.

children.name: big/small
examples: He had small neat feet.

children.name: bare
children.definition: without any socks or shoes
examples: The marble floor felt cold under his bare feet.

children.name: flat
children.definition: having a medical condition in which someone’s feet rest flat on the ground, with no curved part
examples: We’ve both got slightly flat feet.

children.name: booted/sandalled feet
children.definition: wearing boots or sandals
examples: He put down his rucksack and stretched out his booted feet.

children.name: injure/ hurt your foot
examples: Simon injured his foot while playing rugby.

children.name: sb’s foot hurts
examples: She complained that her foot was hurting.

children.name: raise/lift your feet
examples: He raised his foot off the floor and rested it on a chair.

children.name: drag your feet
children.definition: walk slowly in an unwilling way
examples: I was dragging my feet because I didn’t want to get there.

children.name: wipe your feet
children.definition: wipe your shoes on a mat to remove dirt
examples: Be sure to wipe your feet before coming into the house.

children.name: stamp your feet
children.definition: bang them noisily on the ground
examples: He stamped his feet in an attempt to keep warm.

children.name: tap your feet
children.definition: bang them gently on the ground
examples: She was tapping her feet in time with the music.

children.name: shuffle your feet
children.definition: make small movements with them, because you are nervous or impatient
examples: Ken shuffled his feet and looked down at the floor.

children.name: a foot injury
examples: He suffered a foot injury during the match against Sporting Lisbon.

children.name: a foot massage
examples: Would you like a foot massage?

children.name: at sb’s feet
children.definition: on the ground, near your feet
examples: The dog was sitting at his master’s feet.

children.name: in your stockinged/ stocking feet
children.definition: not wearing shoes
examples: She stood 5ft 6 inches tall in her stockinged feet.

children.name: my feet are killing meinformal
children.definition: my feet are hurting

children.name: our four-footed friends
children.definition: animals having four feet

children.name: flat-footed players/ bare-footed children
children.definition: children wearing no shoes

children.name: hand
children.definition: the part of your body at the end of your arm, including your fingers and thumb, that you use to hold , move, touch and feel things:
examples: In her hand was a tattered old photograph.

children.name: sb’s cupped hand
children.definition: in the shape of a cup

children.name: shake sb’s hand
children.definition: alsoshake hands with sb

examples: Nice to meet you,’ he said, as they shook hands.

children.name: take sb’s hand
children.definition: hold someone’s hand

children.name: join hands
children.definition: take hold of the hands of people on either side of you
examples: They stood in a circle and joined hands.

children.name: clasp your hands
children.definition: hold them together tightly
examples: Emily clasped her hands together and stood there nervously.

children.name: fold your hands
children.definition: put your hands together and rest them on something
examples: Lily folded both hands on her stomach.

children.name: raise your hand
children.definition: alsoput your hand up
examples: (= lift your hand, especially when you want to ask or answer a question )If you know the answer, raise your hand.

children.name: sb’s hands shake/ tremble
examples: His hands trembled as he lifted the cup.

children.name: sb’s hand holds sth
examples: His other hand was holding his mobile phone.

children.name: sb’s hand touches sth
examples: Daniel's hand touched mine.

children.name: sb’s hand grips sth
children.definition: hold something firmly
examples: Her hands gripped the steering wheel very tightly.

children.name: sb’s hand grabs/grasps sth
children.definition: take and hold something firmly
examples: He felt Connor's hand grasp his shoulder.

children.name: sb’s hand tightens
examples: Her hand tightened on the knife handle.

children.name: a hand movement
examples: The disease means she has trouble controlling her hand movements.

children.name: a hand gesture/signal
children.definition: a movement of your hand to show what you mean
examples: He made a rude hand gesture at the other driver.

children.name: in sb’s hand
examples: He had a suitcase in his hand.

children.name: on your hands and knees
children.definition: in a crawling position
examples: They got down on their hands and knees to search.

children.name: the palm of your hand
children.definition: the inside surface of your hand
examples: The phone could fit into the palm of his hand.

children.name: the back of your hand
children.definition: the outside surface of your hand
examples: Let a dog sniff the back of your hand, rather than your fingers.

children.name: with your bare hands
children.definition: without using a tool, weapon, machine etc
examples: With his bare hands he forced the doors apart.

children.name: sb’s right/ left hand
examples: She held the book in her right hand.

children.name: sb’s free hand(the hand sb is not already using )
examples: Amy was stroking the dog with her free hand.

children.name: a gloved hand(covered with a glove)
examples: He stretched out a gloved hand.

children.name: an outstretched hand(stretched out towards sb or sth)
examples: She took her father's outstretched hand and began to walk from the room.
Hamil shook the dice in his cupped hand.

children.name: wave your hand
examples: Marta waved a hand to attract his attention.

children.name: clap your hands
examples: They were singing and clapping their hands.

children.name: wash your hands
examples: Go wash your hands before dinner.

children.name: hold hands (with sb)
examples: Joanne and Kevin held hands on the sofa.
He reached across the table and took her hand in his.

children.name: take sb by the hand(hold someone’s hand in order to take them somewhere )
examples: She took the boy by the hand and led him across the street.

children.name: toe
children.definition: one of the five movable parts at the end of your foot: ngón chân
examples: Hestubbedhistoe(= hurt it by kicking it against something )on a rock.
little/big toe(the smallest or largest of your toes )
your big toe/ your little toe
-toed[suffix] having toes as described
the two-toed sloth

children.name: heel
children.definition: the rounded back part of the foot:gót chân

children.name: the heel of your foot(= the curved back part of your foot )
examples: He kicked his opponent with the heel of his foot.

children.name: sole
children.definition: the bottom surface of your foot, especially the part you walk or stand on :lòng bàn chân

children.name: the sole of your foot
examples: The soles of her feet were aching from the long walk.
Thesoles ofhisfeetwere caked in mud.

children.name: instep
children.definition: the raised part of your foot between your toes and your ankle :mu bàn chân

children.name: the instep of your foot
examples: Open your stance slightly, play the ball back - opposite the instep of your right foot - and make a steep, aggressive swing.

children.name: nail
children.definition: your nails are the hard smooth layers on the ends of your fingers and toes : móng
examples: He still had dirt under his nails.

children.name: do your nailsinformal
children.definition: to cut or paint your nails

children.name: break a nail
children.definition: to accidentally damage a nail on one of your fingers

children.name: quick
children.definition: the sensitive flesh under your fingernails and toenails : thịt mềm
examples: He's bitten his nailsto thequick.
Hernailswerebitten to the quick.

children.name: ball
children.definition: the ball of your foot or thumb is the rounded part where the toes join the foot and the thumb joins the hand.

children.name: the ball of your hand/ foot(= the rounded part of your foot at the base of the toes )
examples: He has a blister on the ball of his foot.

children.name: ingrowing
children.definition: (US usuallyingrown) growing into the flesh :mọc vào trong
examples: She's having an operation on an ingrowingtoenail.

children.name: ring finger
children.definition: the finger nearest to your little finger . In many Western cultures, people often wear a ring on their ring finger to show that they are married or are planning to get married. : ngón áp út

children.name: thumb
children.definition: the short thick finger on the side of your hand which makes it possible to hold and pick things up easily : ngón tay cái
examples: a baby sucking its thumb

children.name: middle finger
children.definition: the longest finger on the hand : ngón tay giữa (kế ngón trỏ và ngónáp út)

children.name: little finger
children.definition: / pinkie the smallest finger on each hand : ngón tay út
examples: a pinkie ring

children.name: forefinger
children.definition: /index finger the finger next to the thumb : ngón tay trỏ

children.name: ability to use a particular hand or both hands
ambidextrous
children.definition: able to use both hands equally well: thuận cả hai tay
examples: Few of us are naturally ambidextrous

children.name: left-handed
children.definition: using your left hand to write and do most things : thuận tay trái
examples: Are you left-handed?
a left-handed bowler
left-hander[ C ] sb who uses their left hand to write and do most things

children.name: right-handed
children.definition: using your right hand to write with and do most things: thuận tay phải
examples: She's right-handed.

children.name: fingerprint
children.definition: / fingermark the pattern of curved lines on the end of a finger orthumb,which is different in every person, or a mark left by this pattern : dấu vân tay
examples: His fingerprints were all over the gun.
His fingerprints were all over the gun.
The police havetakenfingerprints from every man in the neighbourhood.
He was careful not toleaveanyfingerprints.
The police questioned Beresford andtookhisfingerprints(= made a record of them ).

children.name: knuckle
children.definition: one of the joints in the hand where your fingers bend, especially where your fingers join on to the main part of your hand : khớp đốt ngón tay
examples: Her knuckles whitened as she gripped the gun.

children.name: palm
children.definition: the inside part of your hand from your wrist to the base of your fingers : lòng bàn tay
examples: This tiny device fits intothepalmofyourhand.

children.name: in sb’s palm
examples: She looked at the coins in her palm.
He held the pebblein the palm of his hand.

children.name: finger
children.definition: any of the long thin separate parts of the hand, especially those which are not thumbs : ngón tay
examples: We ate with our fingers.
run your fingers through/over/along etc something
She ran her fingers through his hair.
-fingered[suffix]with or using the stated number of fingers
two-fingered typing

children.name: fingertip
children.definition: the end of a finger : đầu ngón tay
examples: Use your fingertips to gently flatten the pastry.

children.name: fist
children.definition: a hand with the fingers and thumb held tightly in. People close their hand in a fist when they are angry or are going to hit someone : nắm tay; quả đấm
examples: She held the money tightly in her fist.
Sheclenchedher fists.
Protestors wereshakingtheir fists at the soldiers.
Malcolmclenchedhisfist(= held his fist very tightly closed )angrily.
Dooley stood up andshookhisfistin her face.
Varney slammed his fist down onto the table so hard the dishes jumped.

children.name: manual
children.definition: done with the hands : làm bằng tay, thủ công

children.name: the manual sorting of letters
examples: She tried to cure the pain in my knee by putting manual pressure on the joint.
It would take too long to do a manual search of all the data.
